Core

Class Sprite

  • java.lang.Object
    • Core.Sprite

  • public class Sprite
extends java.lang.Object

    This class is the representation of a Sprite in a Pixel Field.

    It measures as a rectangle, has collision functions. Every class in a Pixel Field must extend from this class
    Version:
    0.4
    Author:

    Marc Albareda

    See Also:
    Git Repository

    • Field Detail

      • MARGIN

        public final int MARGIN
        Margin to detect collisions. This will mark the horizontal range where a top-down collision will not be detected
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • name

        public java.lang.String name
        the name of the sprite

      • x1

        The horizontal position in the field of the upper-left pixel in the sprite

        The vertical position in the field of the upper-left pixel in the sprite

      • x2

        The horizontal position in the field of the bottom-right pixel in the sprite

      • y2

        public int y2
        The vertical position in the field of the bottom-right pixel in the sprite

      • path

        public java.lang.String path
        The path to the image to that Sprite

      • solid

        public boolean solid
        Specifies whether this Sprite is solid. Non-solid sprites will not collide.

      • terrain

        public boolean terrain
        Specifies whether this sprite is terrain. Terrains are immobile objects which can be collided and standed on.

      • text

        public boolean text
        Specifies whether this sprite is text. Text won't use an image path and will print the String specified as path.

      • img

        public java.awt.Image img

      • useImgArray

        public boolean useImgArray

      • currentImg

        public int currentImg

      • imgArray

        public java.awt.Image[] imgArray

      • collidesWithList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> collidesWithList(java.util.ArrayList<? extends Sprite> others)
        Returns the all the Sprites in the provided list that collide with this Sprite
        Parameters:
        others - A list of Sprites or classes that extends Sprite
        Returns:
        A list with all the sprites in the sprites list in the List that collides.
        Returns an Empty list if there is no collision with any Sprite

      • collidesWith

        public boolean collidesWith(Sprite other)
        Checks if this sprite collides with the provided sprite
        Parameters:
        other - The other sprite

      • firstCollidesWithField

        public Sprite firstCollidesWithField(Core.Field f)
        Returns the first Sprite in the provided filed that collides with this Sprite
        Parameters:
        f - A Pixel Field
        Returns:
        The first Sprite in the sprites list in the Pixel Field that collides.
        The Pixel Field is ordered by insertion in the code
        Returns null if there is no collision with any Sprite

      • collidesWithField

        public java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> collidesWithField(Core.Field f)
        Returns the all the Sprites in the provided filed that collide with this Sprite
        Parameters:
        f - A Pixel Field
        Returns:
        A list with all the sprites in the sprites list in the Pixel Field that collides.
        The Pixel Field is ordered by insertion in the code
        Returns an Empty list if there is no collision with any Sprite

      • firstCollidesWithList

        public Sprite firstCollidesWithList(java.util.ArrayList<? extends Sprite> others)
        Returns the first Sprite in the provided list that collides with this Sprite
        Parameters:
        others - A list of Sprites or classes that extends Sprite
        Returns:
        The first Sprite in the llist that collides
        Returns null if there is no collision with any Sprite

      • getCollisionType

        public java.lang.String getCollisionType(Sprite other)
        Returns collision type
        Parameters:
        other - The second sprite
        Returns:
        A String depending on the collision type
        c: Contains. The other sprite is inside this
        i: Inside. This sprite is inside the other
        l: left. There is a collision between the left side of this sprite and any part of the other sprite
        r: right. There is a collision between the right side of this sprite and any part of the other sprite
        u: up. There is a collision between the upper side of this sprite and any part of the other sprite
        d: down. There is a collision between the bottom side of this sprite and any part of the other sprite
        o: other. There is another type of collision between the two sprites. They are colliding, but in an unexpected way
        n: none. There is no collision between the two sprites, or the other sprite is not solid.
        The string may contain several chars. for instance, "lu" would mean there is both a left and an upper collision.
